member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AacSettings
member.summary: Aac Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AacSettings.Bitrate
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Bitrate. Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid values depend on rate control mode and profile.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AacSettings.CodingMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CodingMode. Mono, Stereo, or 5.1 channel layout. Valid values depend on rate control mode and profile. The adReceiverMix setting receives a stereo description plus control track and emits a mono AAC encode of the description track, with control data emitted in the PES header as per ETSI TS 101 154 Annex E.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AacSettings.InputType
member.summary: Gets and sets the property InputType. Set to "broadcasterMixedAd" when input contains pre-mixed main audio + AD (narration) as a stereo pair. The Audio Type field (audioType) will be set to 3, which signals to downstream systems that this stream contains "broadcaster mixed AD". Note that the input received by the encoder must contain pre-mixed audio; the encoder does not perform the mixing. The values in audioTypeControl and audioType (in AudioDescription) are ignored when set to broadcasterMixedAd.Leave set to "normal" when input does not contain pre-mixed audio + AD.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AacSettings.Profile
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Profile. AAC Profile.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AacSettings.RateControlMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RateControlMode. Rate Control Mode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AacSettings.RawFormat
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RawFormat. Sets LATM / LOAS AAC output for raw containers.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AacSettings.SampleRate
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SampleRate. Sample rate in Hz. Valid values depend on rate control mode and profile.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AacSettings.Spec
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Spec. Use MPEG-2 AAC audio instead of MPEG-4 AAC audio for raw or MPEG-2 Transport Stream containers.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AacSettings.VbrQuality
member.summary: Gets and sets the property VbrQuality. VBR Quality Level - Only used if rateControlMode is VBR.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Ac3Settings
member.summary: Ac3 Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Ac3Settings.Bitrate
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Bitrate. Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid bitrates depend on the coding mode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Ac3Settings.BitstreamMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BitstreamMode. Specifies the bitstream mode (bsmod) for the emitted AC-3 stream. See ATSC A/52-2012 for background on these values.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Ac3Settings.CodingMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CodingMode. Dolby Digital coding mode. Determines number of channels.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Ac3Settings.Dialnorm
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Dialnorm. Sets the dialnorm for the output. If excluded and input audio is Dolby Digital, dialnorm will be passed through.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Ac3Settings.DrcProfile
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DrcProfile. If set to filmStandard, adds dynamic range compression signaling to the output bitstream as defined in the Dolby Digital specification.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Ac3Settings.LfeFilter
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LfeFilter. When set to enabled, applies a 120Hz lowpass filter to the LFE channel prior to encoding. Only valid in codingMode32Lfe mode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Ac3Settings.MetadataControl
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MetadataControl. When set to "followInput", encoder metadata will be sourced from the DD, DD+, or DolbyE decoder that supplied this audio data. If audio was not supplied from one of these streams, then the static metadata settings will be used.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AcceptInputDeviceTransferRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the AcceptInputDeviceTransfer operation. Accept an incoming input device transfer. The ownership of the device will transfer to your AWS account.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AcceptInputDeviceTransferRequest.InputDeviceId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property InputDeviceId. The unique ID of the input device to accept. For example, hd-123456789abcdef.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AcceptInputDeviceTransferResponse
member.summary: Placeholder documentation for AcceptInputDeviceTransferResponse

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AncillarySourceSettings
member.summary: Ancillary Source Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AncillarySourceSettings.SourceAncillaryChannelNumber
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SourceAncillaryChannelNumber. Specifies the number (1 to 4) of the captions channel you want to extract from the ancillary captions. If you plan to convert the ancillary captions to another format, complete this field. If you plan to choose Embedded as the captions destination in the output (to pass through all the channels in the ancillary captions), leave this field blank because MediaLive ignores the field.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.ArchiveOutputSettings.NameModifier

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioDescription
member.summary: Audio Description

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioDescription.AudioNormalizationSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioNormalizationSettings. Advanced audio normalization settings.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioDescription.AudioSelectorName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioSelectorName. The name of the AudioSelector used as the source for this AudioDescription.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioDescription.AudioType
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioType. Applies only if audioTypeControl is useConfigured. The values for audioType are defined in ISO-IEC 13818-1.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioDescription.AudioTypeControl
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioTypeControl. Determines how audio type is determined. followInput: If the input contains an ISO 639 audioType, then that value is passed through to the output. If the input contains no ISO 639 audioType, the value in Audio Type is included in the output. useConfigured: The value in Audio Type is included in the output.Note that this field and audioType are both ignored if inputType is broadcasterMixedAd.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioDescription.AudioWatermarkingSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioWatermarkingSettings. Settings to configure one or more solutions that insert audio watermarks in the audio encode

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioDescription.CodecSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CodecSettings. Audio codec settings.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioDescription.LanguageCode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LanguageCode. RFC 5646 language code representing the language of the audio output track. Only used if languageControlMode is useConfigured, or there is no ISO 639 language code specified in the input.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioDescription.LanguageCodeControl
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LanguageCodeControl. Choosing followInput will cause the ISO 639 language code of the output to follow the ISO 639 language code of the input. The languageCode will be used when useConfigured is set, or when followInput is selected but there is no ISO 639 language code specified by the input.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioDescription.Name
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Name. The name of this AudioDescription. Outputs will use this name to uniquely identify this AudioDescription. Description names should be unique within this Live Event.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioDescription.RemixSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RemixSettings. Settings that control how input audio channels are remixed into the output audio channels.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioDescription.StreamName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property StreamName. Used for MS Smooth and Apple HLS outputs. Indicates the name displayed by the player (eg. English, or Director Commentary).

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioHlsRenditionSelection
member.summary: Audio Hls Rendition Selection

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioHlsRenditionSelection.GroupId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property GroupId. Specifies the GROUP-ID in the #EXT-X-MEDIA tag of the target HLS audio rendition.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioHlsRenditionSelection.Name
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Name. Specifies the NAME in the #EXT-X-MEDIA tag of the target HLS audio rendition.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioLanguageSelection
member.summary: Audio Language Selection

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioLanguageSelection.LanguageCode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LanguageCode. Selects a specific three-letter language code from within an audio source.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioLanguageSelection.LanguageSelectionPolicy
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LanguageSelectionPolicy. When set to "strict", the transport stream demux strictly identifies audio streams by their language descriptor. If a PMT update occurs such that an audio stream matching the initially selected language is no longer present then mute will be encoded until the language returns. If "loose", then on a PMT update the demux will choose another audio stream in the program with the same stream type if it can't find one with the same language.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioNormalizationSettings
member.summary: Audio Normalization Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioNormalizationSettings.Algorithm
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Algorithm. Audio normalization algorithm to use. itu17701 conforms to the CALM Act specification, itu17702 conforms to the EBU R-128 specification.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioNormalizationSettings.AlgorithmControl
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AlgorithmControl. When set to correctAudio the output audio is corrected using the chosen algorithm. If set to measureOnly, the audio will be measured but not adjusted.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioNormalizationSettings.TargetLkfs
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TargetLkfs. Target LKFS(loudness) to adjust volume to. If no value is entered, a default value will be used according to the chosen algorithm. The CALM Act (1770-1) recommends a target of -24 LKFS. The EBU R-128 specification (1770-2) recommends a target of -23 LKFS.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioOnlyHlsSettings
member.summary: Audio Only Hls Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioOnlyHlsSettings.AudioGroupId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioGroupId. Specifies the group to which the audio Rendition belongs.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioOnlyHlsSettings.AudioOnlyImage
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioOnlyImage. Optional. Specifies the .jpg or .png image to use as the cover art for an audio-only output. We recommend a low bit-size file because the image increases the output audio bandwidth.The image is attached to the audio as an ID3 tag, frame type APIC, picture type 0x10, as per the "ID3 tag version 2.4.0 - Native Frames" standard.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioOnlyHlsSettings.AudioTrackType
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioTrackType. Four types of audio-only tracks are supported:Audio-Only Variant StreamThe client can play back this audio-only stream instead of video in low-bandwidth scenarios. Represented as an EXT-X-STREAM-INF in the HLS manifest.Alternate Audio, Auto Select, DefaultAlternate rendition that the client should try to play back by default. Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=YES, AUTOSELECT=YESAlternate Audio, Auto Select, Not DefaultAlternate rendition that the client may try to play back by default. Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=NO, AUTOSELECT=YESAlternate Audio, not Auto SelectAlternate rendition that the client will not try to play back by default. Represented as an EXT-X-MEDIA in the HLS manifest with DEFAULT=NO, AUTOSELECT=NO

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioOnlyHlsSettings.SegmentType
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentType. Specifies the segment type.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioPidSelection
member.summary: Audio Pid Selection

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioPidSelection.Pid
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Pid. Selects a specific PID from within a source.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioSelector.Name
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Name. The name of this AudioSelector. AudioDescriptions will use this name to uniquely identify this Selector. Selector names should be unique per input.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioSelector.SelectorSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SelectorSettings. The audio selector settings.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioLanguageSelection.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioPidSelection.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioSelectorSettings.AudioTrackSelection
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioTrackSelection.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioSilenceFailoverSettings
member.summary: Placeholder documentation for AudioSilenceFailoverSettings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioSilenceFailoverSettings.AudioSelectorName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioSelectorName. The name of the audio selector in the input that MediaLive should monitor to detect silence. Select your most important rendition. If you didn't create an audio selector in this input, leave blank.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioSilenceFailoverSettings.AudioSilenceThresholdMsec
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioSilenceThresholdMsec. The amount of time (in milliseconds) that the active input must be silent before automatic input failover occurs. Silence is defined as audio loss or audio quieter than -50 dBFS.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioTrack
member.summary: Audio Track

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioTrack.Track
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Track. 1-based integer value that maps to a specific audio track

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioTrackSelection
member.summary: Audio Track Selection

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioTrackSelection.Tracks
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Tracks. Selects one or more unique audio tracks from within a source.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioWatermarkSettings
member.summary: Audio Watermark Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AudioWatermarkSettings.NielsenWatermarksSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property NielsenWatermarksSettings. Settings to configure Nielsen Watermarks in the audio encode

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings
member.summary: The settings for Automatic Input Failover.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings.ErrorClearTimeMsec
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ErrorClearTimeMsec. This clear time defines the requirement a recovered input must meet to be considered healthy. The input must have no failover conditions for this length of time. Enter a time in milliseconds. This value is particularly important if the input_preference for the failover pair is set to PRIMARY_INPUT_PREFERRED, because after this time, MediaLive will switch back to the primary input.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings.FailoverConditions
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FailoverConditions. A list of failover conditions. If any of these conditions occur, MediaLive will perform a failover to the other input.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings.InputPreference
member.summary: Gets and sets the property InputPreference. Input preference when deciding which input to make active when a previously failed input has recovered.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AutomaticInputFailoverSettings.SecondaryInputId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SecondaryInputId. The input ID of the secondary input in the automatic input failover pair.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AvailBlanking
member.summary: Avail Blanking

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AvailBlanking.AvailBlankingImage
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AvailBlankingImage. Blanking image to be used. Leave empty for solid black. Only bmp and png images are supported.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.AvailBlanking.State
member.summary: Gets and sets the property State. When set to enabled, causes video, audio and captions to be blanked when insertion metadata is added.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BlackoutSlate
member.summary: Blackout Slate

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BlackoutSlate.BlackoutSlateImage
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BlackoutSlateImage. Blackout slate image to be used. Leave empty for solid black. Only bmp and png images are supported.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BlackoutSlate.NetworkEndBlackout
member.summary: Gets and sets the property NetworkEndBlackout. Setting to enabled causes the encoder to blackout the video, audio, and captions, and raise the "Network Blackout Image" slate when an SCTE104/35 Network End Segmentation Descriptor is encountered. The blackout will be lifted when the Network Start Segmentation Descriptor is encountered. The Network End and Network Start descriptors must contain a network ID that matches the value entered in "Network ID".

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BlackoutSlate.NetworkEndBlackoutImage
member.summary: Gets and sets the property NetworkEndBlackoutImage. Path to local file to use as Network End Blackout image. Image will be scaled to fill the entire output raster.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BlackoutSlate.NetworkId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property NetworkId. Provides Network ID that matches EIDR ID format (e.g., "10.XXXX/XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-C").

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BlackoutSlate.State
member.summary: Gets and sets the property State. When set to enabled, causes video, audio and captions to be blanked when indicated by program metadata.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BurnInDestinationSettings
member.summary: Burn In Destination Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BurnInDestinationSettings.Alignment
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Alignment. If no explicit xPosition or yPosition is provided, setting alignment to centered will place the captions at the bottom center of the output. Similarly, setting a left alignment will align captions to the bottom left of the output. If x and y positions are given in conjunction with the alignment parameter, the font will be justified (either left or centered) relative to those coordinates. Selecting "smart" justification will left-justify live subtitles and center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BurnInDestinationSettings.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BackgroundColor. Specifies the color of the rectangle behind the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BurnInDestinationSettings.BackgroundOpacity
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BackgroundOpacity. Specifies the opacity of the background rectangle. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. Leaving this parameter out is equivalent to setting it to 0 (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BurnInDestinationSettings.Font
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Font. External font file used for caption burn-in. File extension must be 'ttf' or 'tte'. Although the user can select output fonts for many different types of input captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources use a strict grid system. Using external fonts with these caption sources could cause unexpected display of proportional fonts. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BurnInDestinationSettings.FontColor
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FontColor. Specifies the color of the burned-in captions. This option is not valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BurnInDestinationSettings.FontOpacity
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FontOpacity. Specifies the opacity of the burned-in captions. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BurnInDestinationSettings.FontResolution
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FontResolution. Font resolution in DPI (dots per inch); default is 96 dpi. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BurnInDestinationSettings.FontSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FontSize. When set to 'auto' fontSize will scale depending on the size of the output. Giving a positive integer will specify the exact font size in points. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BurnInDestinationSettings.OutlineColor
member.summary: Gets and sets the property OutlineColor. Specifies font outline color. This option is not valid for source captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BurnInDestinationSettings.OutlineSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the property OutlineSize. Specifies font outline size in pixels. This option is not valid for source captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BurnInDestinationSettings.ShadowColor
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ShadowColor. Specifies the color of the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BurnInDestinationSettings.ShadowOpacity
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ShadowOpacity. Specifies the opacity of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. Leaving this parameter out is equivalent to setting it to 0 (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BurnInDestinationSettings.ShadowXOffset
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ShadowXOffset. Specifies the horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to the left. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BurnInDestinationSettings.ShadowYOffset
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ShadowYOffset. Specifies the vertical offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels above the text. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BurnInDestinationSettings.TeletextGridControl
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TeletextGridControl. Controls whether a fixed grid size will be used to generate the output subtitles bitmap. Only applicable for Teletext inputs and DVB-Sub/Burn-in outputs.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BurnInDestinationSettings.XPosition
member.summary: Gets and sets the property XPosition. Specifies the horizontal position of the caption relative to the left side of the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels from the left of the output. If no explicit xPosition is provided, the horizontal caption position will be determined by the alignment parameter. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.BurnInDestinationSettings.YPosition
member.summary: Gets and sets the property YPosition. Specifies the vertical position of the caption relative to the top of the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels from the top of the output. If no explicit yPosition is provided, the caption will be positioned towards the bottom of the output. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.summary: Maps a caption channel to an ISO 693-2 language code (http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2), with an optional description.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.CaptionLanguageMapping.CaptionChannel
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CaptionChannel. The closed caption channel being described by this CaptionLanguageMapping. Each channel mapping must have a unique channel number (maximum of 4)

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.CaptionLanguageMapping.LanguageCode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LanguageCode. Three character ISO 639-2 language code (see http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2)

member.summary: Gets and sets the property LanguageDescription. Textual description of language

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.CaptionRectangle
member.summary: Caption Rectangle

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.CaptionRectangle.Height
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Height. See the description in leftOffset.For height, specify the entire height of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame height. For example, \"80\" means the rectangle height is 80% of the underlying frame height. The topOffset and rectangleHeight must add up to 100% or less.This field corresponds to tts:extent - Y in the TTML standard.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.CaptionRectangle.LeftOffset
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LeftOffset. Applies only if you plan to convert these source captions to EBU-TT-D or TTML in an output. (Make sure to leave the default if you don't have either of these formats in the output.) You can define a display rectangle for the captions that is smaller than the underlying video frame. You define the rectangle by specifying the position of the left edge, top edge, bottom edge, and right edge of the rectangle, all within the underlying video frame. The units for the measurements are percentages.If you specify a value for one of these fields, you must specify a value for all of them.For leftOffset, specify the position of the left edge of the rectangle, as a percentage of the underlying frame width, and relative to the left edge of the frame. For example, \"10\" means the measurement is 10% of the underlying frame width. The rectangle left edge starts at that position from the left edge of the frame.This field corresponds to tts:origin - X in the TTML standard.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.CaptionRectangle.TopOffset
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TopOffset. See the description in leftOffset.For topOffset, specify the position of the top edge of the rectangle, as a percentage of the underlying frame height, and relative to the top edge of the frame. For example, \"10\" means the measurement is 10% of the underlying frame height. The rectangle top edge starts at that position from the top edge of the frame.This field corresponds to tts:origin - Y in the TTML standard.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.CaptionRectangle.Width
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Width. See the description in leftOffset.For width, specify the entire width of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame width. For example, \"80\" means the rectangle width is 80% of the underlying frame width. The leftOffset and rectangleWidth must add up to 100% or less.This field corresponds to tts:extent - X in the TTML standard.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DescribeInputResponse.InputClass
member.summary: Gets and sets the property InputClass. STANDARD - MediaLive expects two sources to be connected to this input. If the channel is also STANDARD, both sources will be ingested. If the channel is SINGLE_PIPELINE, only the first source will be ingested; the second source will always be ignored, even if the first source fails.SINGLE_PIPELINE - You can connect only one source to this input. If the ChannelClass is also SINGLE_PIPELINE, this value is valid. If the ChannelClass is STANDARD, this value is not valid because the channel requires two sources in the input.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbNitSettings
member.summary: DVB Network Information Table (NIT)

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbNitSettings.NetworkId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property NetworkId. The numeric value placed in the Network Information Table (NIT).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbNitSettings.NetworkName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property NetworkName. The network name text placed in the networkNameDescriptor inside the Network Information Table. Maximum length is 256 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbNitSettings.RepInterval
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RepInterval. The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the output transport stream.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSdtSettings
member.summary: DVB Service Description Table (SDT)

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSdtSettings.OutputSdt
member.summary: Gets and sets the property OutputSdt. Selects method of inserting SDT information into output stream. The sdtFollow setting copies SDT information from input stream to output stream. The sdtFollowIfPresent setting copies SDT information from input stream to output stream if SDT information is present in the input, otherwise it will fall back on the user-defined values. The sdtManual setting means user will enter the SDT information. The sdtNone setting means output stream will not contain SDT information.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSdtSettings.RepInterval
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RepInterval. The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the output transport stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSdtSettings.ServiceName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ServiceName. The service name placed in the serviceDescriptor in the Service Description Table. Maximum length is 256 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSdtSettings.ServiceProviderName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ServiceProviderName. The service provider name placed in the serviceDescriptor in the Service Description Table. Maximum length is 256 characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubDestinationSettings
member.summary: Dvb Sub Destination Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubDestinationSettings.Alignment
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Alignment. If no explicit xPosition or yPosition is provided, setting alignment to centered will place the captions at the bottom center of the output. Similarly, setting a left alignment will align captions to the bottom left of the output. If x and y positions are given in conjunction with the alignment parameter, the font will be justified (either left or centered) relative to those coordinates. Selecting "smart" justification will left-justify live subtitles and center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. This option is not valid for source captions that are STL or 608/embedded. These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubDestinationSettings.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BackgroundColor. Specifies the color of the rectangle behind the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubDestinationSettings.BackgroundOpacity
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BackgroundOpacity. Specifies the opacity of the background rectangle. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. Leaving this parameter blank is equivalent to setting it to 0 (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubDestinationSettings.Font
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Font. External font file used for caption burn-in. File extension must be 'ttf' or 'tte'. Although the user can select output fonts for many different types of input captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources use a strict grid system. Using external fonts with these caption sources could cause unexpected display of proportional fonts. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubDestinationSettings.FontColor
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FontColor. Specifies the color of the burned-in captions. This option is not valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubDestinationSettings.FontOpacity
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FontOpacity. Specifies the opacity of the burned-in captions. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubDestinationSettings.FontResolution
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FontResolution. Font resolution in DPI (dots per inch); default is 96 dpi. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubDestinationSettings.FontSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FontSize. When set to auto fontSize will scale depending on the size of the output. Giving a positive integer will specify the exact font size in points. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubDestinationSettings.OutlineColor
member.summary: Gets and sets the property OutlineColor. Specifies font outline color. This option is not valid for source captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubDestinationSettings.OutlineSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the property OutlineSize. Specifies font outline size in pixels. This option is not valid for source captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubDestinationSettings.ShadowColor
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ShadowColor. Specifies the color of the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubDestinationSettings.ShadowOpacity
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ShadowOpacity. Specifies the opacity of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. Leaving this parameter blank is equivalent to setting it to 0 (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubDestinationSettings.ShadowXOffset
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ShadowXOffset. Specifies the horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to the left. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubDestinationSettings.ShadowYOffset
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ShadowYOffset. Specifies the vertical offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels above the text. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubDestinationSettings.TeletextGridControl
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TeletextGridControl. Controls whether a fixed grid size will be used to generate the output subtitles bitmap. Only applicable for Teletext inputs and DVB-Sub/Burn-in outputs.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubDestinationSettings.XPosition
member.summary: Gets and sets the property XPosition. Specifies the horizontal position of the caption relative to the left side of the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels from the left of the output. If no explicit xPosition is provided, the horizontal caption position will be determined by the alignment parameter. This option is not valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubDestinationSettings.YPosition
member.summary: Gets and sets the property YPosition. Specifies the vertical position of the caption relative to the top of the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels from the top of the output. If no explicit yPosition is provided, the caption will be positioned towards the bottom of the output. This option is not valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubSourceSettings
member.summary: Dvb Sub Source Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubSourceSettings.OcrLanguage
member.summary: Gets and sets the property OcrLanguage. If you will configure a WebVTT caption description that references this caption selector, use this field toprovide the language to consider when translating the image-based source to text.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbSubSourceSettings.Pid
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Pid. When using DVB-Sub with Burn-In or SMPTE-TT, use this PID for the source content. Unused for DVB-Sub passthrough. All DVB-Sub content is passed through, regardless of selectors.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbTdtSettings
member.summary: DVB Time and Date Table (SDT)

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.DvbTdtSettings.RepInterval
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RepInterval. The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the output transport stream.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings
member.summary: Eac3 Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.AttenuationControl
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AttenuationControl. When set to attenuate3Db, applies a 3 dB attenuation to the surround channels. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.Bitrate
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Bitrate. Average bitrate in bits/second. Valid bitrates depend on the coding mode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.BitstreamMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BitstreamMode. Specifies the bitstream mode (bsmod) for the emitted E-AC-3 stream. See ATSC A/52-2012 (Annex E) for background on these values.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.CodingMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CodingMode. Dolby Digital Plus coding mode. Determines number of channels.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.DcFilter
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DcFilter. When set to enabled, activates a DC highpass filter for all input channels.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.Dialnorm
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Dialnorm. Sets the dialnorm for the output. If blank and input audio is Dolby Digital Plus, dialnorm will be passed through.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.DrcLine
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DrcLine. Sets the Dolby dynamic range compression profile.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.DrcRf
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DrcRf. Sets the profile for heavy Dolby dynamic range compression, ensures that the instantaneous signal peaks do not exceed specified levels.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.LfeControl
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LfeControl. When encoding 3/2 audio, setting to lfe enables the LFE channel

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.LfeFilter
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LfeFilter. When set to enabled, applies a 120Hz lowpass filter to the LFE channel prior to encoding. Only valid with codingMode32 coding mode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.LoRoCenterMixLevel
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LoRoCenterMixLevel. Left only/Right only center mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.LoRoSurroundMixLevel
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LoRoSurroundMixLevel. Left only/Right only surround mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.LtRtCenterMixLevel
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LtRtCenterMixLevel. Left total/Right total center mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.LtRtSurroundMixLevel
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LtRtSurroundMixLevel. Left total/Right total surround mix level. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.MetadataControl
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MetadataControl. When set to followInput, encoder metadata will be sourced from the DD, DD+, or DolbyE decoder that supplied this audio data. If audio was not supplied from one of these streams, then the static metadata settings will be used.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.PassthroughControl
member.summary: Gets and sets the property PassthroughControl. When set to whenPossible, input DD+ audio will be passed through if it is present on the input. This detection is dynamic over the life of the transcode. Inputs that alternate between DD+ and non-DD+ content will have a consistent DD+ output as the system alternates between passthrough and encoding.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.PhaseControl
member.summary: Gets and sets the property PhaseControl. When set to shift90Degrees, applies a 90-degree phase shift to the surround channels. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.StereoDownmix
member.summary: Gets and sets the property StereoDownmix. Stereo downmix preference. Only used for 3/2 coding mode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.SurroundExMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SurroundExMode. When encoding 3/2 audio, sets whether an extra center back surround channel is matrix encoded into the left and right surround channels.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Eac3Settings.SurroundMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SurroundMode. When encoding 2/0 audio, sets whether Dolby Surround is matrix encoded into the two channels.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.EbuTtDDestinationSettings
member.summary: Ebu Tt DDestination Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.EbuTtDDestinationSettings.CopyrightHolder
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CopyrightHolder. Applies only if you plan to convert these source captions to EBU-TT-D or TTML in an output. Complete this field if you want to include the name of the copyright holder in the copyright metadata tag in the TTML

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.EbuTtDDestinationSettings.FillLineGap
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FillLineGap. Specifies how to handle the gap between the lines (in multi-line captions).- enabled: Fill with the captions background color (as specified in the input captions).- disabled: Leave the gap unfilled.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.EbuTtDDestinationSettings.FontFamily
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FontFamily. Specifies the font family to include in the font data attached to the EBU-TT captions. Valid only if styleControl is set to include. If you leave this field empty, the font family is set to "monospaced". (If styleControl is set to exclude, the font family is always set to "monospaced".)You specify only the font family. All other style information (color, bold, position and so on) is copied from the input captions. The size is always set to 100% to allow the downstream player to choose the size.- Enter a list of font families, as a comma-separated list of font names, in order of preference. The name can be a font family (such as “Arial”), or a generic font family (such as “serif”), or “default” (to let the downstream player choose the font).- Leave blank to set the family to “monospace”.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.EbuTtDDestinationSettings.StyleControl
member.summary: Gets and sets the property StyleControl. Specifies the style information (font color, font position, and so on) to include in the font data that is attached to the EBU-TT captions.- include: Take the style information (font color, font position, and so on) from the source captions and include that information in the font data attached to the EBU-TT captions. This option is valid only if the source captions are Embedded or Teletext.- exclude: In the font data attached to the EBU-TT captions, set the font family to "monospaced". Do not include any other style information.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property Convert608To708. If upconvert, 608 data is both passed through via the "608 compatibility bytes" fields of the 708 wrapper as well as translated into 708. 708 data present in the source content will be discarded.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.EmbeddedSourceSettings.Scte20Detection
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Scte20Detection. Set to "auto" to handle streams with intermittent and/or non-aligned SCTE-20 and Embedded captions.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.EmbeddedSourceSettings.Source608ChannelNumber
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Source608ChannelNumber. Specifies the 608/708 channel number within the video track from which to extract captions. Unused for passthrough.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property FailoverConditionSettings. Failover condition type-specific settings.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioSilenceSettings. MediaLive will perform a failover if the specified audio selector is silent for the specified period.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property InputLossSettings. MediaLive will perform a failover if content is not detected in this input for the specified period.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property VideoBlackSettings. MediaLive will perform a failover if content is considered black for the specified period.

member.summary: Feature Activations

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.FeatureActivations.InputPrepareScheduleActions
member.summary: Gets and sets the property InputPrepareScheduleActions. Enables the Input Prepare feature. You can create Input Prepare actions in the schedule only if this feature is enabled.If you disable the feature on an existing schedule, make sure that you first delete all input prepare actions from the schedule.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.FecOutputSettings
member.summary: Fec Output Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.FecOutputSettings.ColumnDepth
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ColumnDepth. Parameter D from SMPTE 2022-1. The height of the FEC protection matrix. The number of transport stream packets per column error correction packet. Must be between 4 and 20, inclusive.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.FecOutputSettings.IncludeFec
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IncludeFec. Enables column only or column and row based FEC

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.FecOutputSettings.RowLength
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RowLength. Parameter L from SMPTE 2022-1. The width of the FEC protection matrix. Must be between 1 and 20, inclusive. If only Column FEC is used, then larger values increase robustness. If Row FEC is used, then this is the number of transport stream packets per row error correction packet, and the value must be between 4 and 20, inclusive, if includeFec is columnAndRow. If includeFec is column, this value must be 1 to 20, inclusive.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings
member.summary: Start time for the action.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings.Time
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Time. Start time for the action to start in the channel. (Not the time for the action to be added to the schedule: actions are always added to the schedule immediately.) UTC format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ. All the letters are digits (for example, mm might be 01) except for the two constants "T" for time and "Z" for "UTC format".

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Fmp4HlsSettings.NielsenId3Behavior
member.summary: Gets and sets the property NielsenId3Behavior. If set to passthrough, Nielsen inaudible tones for media tracking will be detected in the input audio and an equivalent ID3 tag will be inserted in the output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Fmp4HlsSettings.TimedMetadataBehavior
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TimedMetadataBehavior. When set to passthrough, timed metadata is passed through from input to output.

member.summary: Frame Capture Group Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.FrameCaptureGroupSettings.Destination
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Destination. The destination for the frame capture files. Either the URI for an Amazon S3 bucket and object, plus a file name prefix (for example, s3ssl://sportsDelivery/highlights/20180820/curling-) or the URI for a MediaStore container, plus a file name prefix (for example, mediastoressl://sportsDelivery/20180820/curling-). The final file names consist of the prefix from the destination field (for example, "curling-") + name modifier + the counter (5 digits, starting from 00001) + extension (which is always .jpg). For example, curling-low.00001.jpg

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.FrameCaptureGroupSettings.FrameCaptureCdnSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FrameCaptureCdnSettings. Parameters that control interactions with the CDN.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.GlobalConfiguration
member.summary: Global Configuration

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.GlobalConfiguration.InitialAudioGain
member.summary: Gets and sets the property InitialAudioGain. Value to set the initial audio gain for the Live Event.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.GlobalConfiguration.InputEndAction
member.summary: Gets and sets the property InputEndAction. Indicates the action to take when the current input completes (e.g. end-of-file). When switchAndLoopInputs is configured the encoder will restart at the beginning of the first input. When "none" is configured the encoder will transcode either black, a solid color, or a user specified slate images per the "Input Loss Behavior" configuration until the next input switch occurs (which is controlled through the Channel Schedule API).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.GlobalConfiguration.InputLossBehavior
member.summary: Gets and sets the property InputLossBehavior. Settings for system actions when input is lost.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.GlobalConfiguration.OutputLockingMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property OutputLockingMode. Indicates how MediaLive pipelines are synchronized.PIPELINE_LOCKING - MediaLive will attempt to synchronize the output of each pipeline to the other.EPOCH_LOCKING - MediaLive will attempt to synchronize the output of each pipeline to the Unix epoch.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.GlobalConfiguration.OutputTimingSource
member.summary: Gets and sets the property OutputTimingSource. Indicates whether the rate of frames emitted by the Live encoder should be paced by its system clock (which optionally may be locked to another source via NTP) or should be locked to the clock of the source that is providing the input stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.GlobalConfiguration.SupportLowFramerateInputs
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SupportLowFramerateInputs. Adjusts video input buffer for streams with very low video framerates. This is commonly set to enabled for music channels with less than one video frame per second.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264ColorSpaceSettings
member.summary: H264 Color Space Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264ColorSpaceSettings.ColorSpacePassthroughSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ColorSpacePassthroughSettings.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264ColorSpaceSettings.Rec601Settings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Rec601Settings.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264ColorSpaceSettings.Rec709Settings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Rec709Settings.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264FilterSettings
member.summary: H264 Filter Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264FilterSettings.TemporalFilterSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TemporalFilterSettings.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings
member.summary: H264 Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.AdaptiveQuantization
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AdaptiveQuantization. Enables or disables adaptive quantization, which is a technique MediaLive can apply to video on a frame-by-frame basis to produce more compression without losing quality. There are three types of adaptive quantization: flicker, spatial, and temporal. Set the field in one of these ways: Set to Auto. Recommended. For each type of AQ, MediaLive will determine if AQ is needed, and if so, the appropriate strength. Set a strength (a value other than Auto or Disable). This strength will apply to any of the AQ fields that you choose to enable. Set to Disabled to disable all types of adaptive quantization.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.AfdSignaling
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AfdSignaling. Indicates that AFD values will be written into the output stream. If afdSignaling is "auto", the system will try to preserve the input AFD value (in cases where multiple AFD values are valid). If set to "fixed", the AFD value will be the value configured in the fixedAfd parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.Bitrate
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Bitrate. Average bitrate in bits/second. Required when the rate control mode is VBR or CBR. Not used for QVBR. In an MS Smooth output group, each output must have a unique value when its bitrate is rounded down to the nearest multiple of 1000.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.BufFillPct
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BufFillPct. Percentage of the buffer that should initially be filled (HRD buffer model).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.BufSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BufSize. Size of buffer (HRD buffer model) in bits.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.ColorMetadata
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ColorMetadata. Includes colorspace metadata in the output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.ColorSpaceSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ColorSpaceSettings. Color Space settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.EntropyEncoding
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EntropyEncoding. Entropy encoding mode. Use cabac (must be in Main or High profile) or cavlc.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.FilterSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FilterSettings. Optional filters that you can apply to an encode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.FixedAfd
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FixedAfd. Four bit AFD value to write on all frames of video in the output stream. Only valid when afdSignaling is set to 'Fixed'.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.FlickerAq
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FlickerAq. Flicker AQ makes adjustments within each frame to reduce flicker or 'pop' on I-frames. The value to enter in this field depends on the value in the Adaptive quantization field: If you have set the Adaptive quantization field to Auto, MediaLive ignores any value in this field. MediaLive will determine if flicker AQ is appropriate and will apply the appropriate strength. If you have set the Adaptive quantization field to a strength, you can set this field to Enabled or Disabled. Enabled: MediaLive will apply flicker AQ using the specified strength. Disabled: MediaLive won't apply flicker AQ. If you have set the Adaptive quantization to Disabled, MediaLive ignores any value in this field and doesn't apply flicker AQ.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.ForceFieldPictures
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ForceFieldPictures. This setting applies only when scan type is "interlaced." It controls whether coding is performed on a field basis or on a frame basis. (When the video is progressive, the coding is always performed on a frame basis.)enabled: Force MediaLive to code on a field basis, so that odd and even sets of fields are coded separately.disabled: Code the two sets of fields separately (on a field basis) or together (on a frame basis using PAFF), depending on what is most appropriate for the content.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.FramerateControl
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FramerateControl. This field indicates how the output video frame rate is specified. If "specified" is selected then the output video frame rate is determined by framerateNumerator and framerateDenominator, else if "initializeFromSource" is selected then the output video frame rate will be set equal to the input video frame rate of the first input.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.FramerateDenominator
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FramerateDenominator. Framerate denominator.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.FramerateNumerator
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FramerateNumerator. Framerate numerator - framerate is a fraction, e.g. 24000 / 1001 = 23.976 fps.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.GopBReference
member.summary: Gets and sets the property GopBReference. Documentation update needed

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.GopClosedCadence
member.summary: Gets and sets the property GopClosedCadence. Frequency of closed GOPs. In streaming applications, it is recommended that this be set to 1 so a decoder joining mid-stream will receive an IDR frame as quickly as possible. Setting this value to 0 will break output segmenting.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.GopNumBFrames
member.summary: Gets and sets the property GopNumBFrames. Number of B-frames between reference frames.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.GopSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the property GopSize. GOP size (keyframe interval) in units of either frames or seconds per gopSizeUnits.If gopSizeUnits is frames, gopSize must be an integer and must be greater than or equal to 1.If gopSizeUnits is seconds, gopSize must be greater than 0, but need not be an integer.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.GopSizeUnits
member.summary: Gets and sets the property GopSizeUnits. Indicates if the gopSize is specified in frames or seconds. If seconds the system will convert the gopSize into a frame count at run time.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.Level
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Level. H.264 Level.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.LookAheadRateControl
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LookAheadRateControl. Amount of lookahead. A value of low can decrease latency and memory usage, while high can produce better quality for certain content.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.MaxBitrate
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MaxBitrate. For QVBR: See the tooltip for Quality levelFor VBR: Set the maximum bitrate in order to accommodate expected spikes in the complexity of the video.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.MinIInterval
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MinIInterval. Only meaningful if sceneChangeDetect is set to enabled. Defaults to 5 if multiplex rate control is used. Enforces separation between repeated (cadence) I-frames and I-frames inserted by Scene Change Detection. If a scene change I-frame is within I-interval frames of a cadence I-frame, the GOP is shrunk and/or stretched to the scene change I-frame. GOP stretch requires enabling lookahead as well as setting I-interval. The normal cadence resumes for the next GOP. Note: Maximum GOP stretch = GOP size + Min-I-interval - 1

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.NumRefFrames
member.summary: Gets and sets the property NumRefFrames. Number of reference frames to use. The encoder may use more than requested if using B-frames and/or interlaced encoding.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.ParControl
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ParControl. This field indicates how the output pixel aspect ratio is specified. If "specified" is selected then the output video pixel aspect ratio is determined by parNumerator and parDenominator, else if "initializeFromSource" is selected then the output pixsel aspect ratio will be set equal to the input video pixel aspect ratio of the first input.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.ParDenominator
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ParDenominator. Pixel Aspect Ratio denominator.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.ParNumerator
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ParNumerator. Pixel Aspect Ratio numerator.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.Profile
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Profile. H.264 Profile.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.QualityLevel
member.summary: Gets and sets the property QualityLevel. Leave as STANDARD_QUALITY or choose a different value (which might result in additional costs to run the channel).- ENHANCED_QUALITY: Produces a slightly better video quality without an increase in the bitrate. Has an effect only when the Rate control mode is QVBR or CBR. If this channel is in a MediaLive multiplex, the value must be ENHANCED_QUALITY.- STANDARD_QUALITY: Valid for any Rate control mode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.QvbrQualityLevel
member.summary: Gets and sets the property QvbrQualityLevel. Controls the target quality for the video encode. Applies only when the rate control mode is QVBR. You can set a target quality or you can let MediaLive determine the best quality. To set a target quality, enter values in the QVBR quality level field and the Max bitrate field. Enter values that suit your most important viewing devices. Recommended values are:- Primary screen: Quality level: 8 to 10. Max bitrate: 4M- PC or tablet: Quality level: 7. Max bitrate: 1.5M to 3M- Smartphone: Quality level: 6. Max bitrate: 1M to 1.5MTo let MediaLive decide, leave the QVBR quality level field empty, and in Max bitrate enter the maximum rate you want in the video. For more information, see the section called "Video - rate control mode" in the MediaLive user guide

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.RateControlMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RateControlMode. Rate control mode.QVBR: Quality will match the specified quality level except when it is constrained by themaximum bitrate. Recommended if you or your viewers pay for bandwidth.VBR: Quality and bitrate vary, depending on the video complexity. Recommended instead of QVBRif you want to maintain a specific average bitrate over the duration of the channel.CBR: Quality varies, depending on the video complexity. Recommended only if you distributeyour assets to devices that cannot handle variable bitrates.Multiplex: This rate control mode is only supported (and is required) when the video is beingdelivered to a MediaLive Multiplex in which case the rate control configuration is controlledby the properties within the Multiplex Program.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.ScanType
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ScanType. Sets the scan type of the output to progressive or top-field-first interlaced.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.SceneChangeDetect
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SceneChangeDetect. Scene change detection.- On: inserts I-frames when scene change is detected.- Off: does not force an I-frame when scene change is detected.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.Slices
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Slices. Number of slices per picture. Must be less than or equal to the number of macroblock rows for progressive pictures, and less than or equal to half the number of macroblock rows for interlaced pictures.This field is optional; when no value is specified the encoder will choose the number of slices based on encode resolution.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.Softness
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Softness. Softness. Selects quantizer matrix, larger values reduce high-frequency content in the encoded image. If not set to zero, must be greater than 15.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.SpatialAq
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SpatialAq. Spatial AQ makes adjustments within each frame based on spatial variation of content complexity. The value to enter in this field depends on the value in the Adaptive quantization field: If you have set the Adaptive quantization field to Auto, MediaLive ignores any value in this field. MediaLive will determine if spatial AQ is appropriate and will apply the appropriate strength. If you have set the Adaptive quantization field to a strength, you can set this field to Enabled or Disabled. Enabled: MediaLive will apply spatial AQ using the specified strength. Disabled: MediaLive won't apply spatial AQ. If you have set the Adaptive quantization to Disabled, MediaLive ignores any value in this field and doesn't apply spatial AQ.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.SubgopLength
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SubgopLength. If set to fixed, use gopNumBFrames B-frames per sub-GOP. If set to dynamic, optimize the number of B-frames used for each sub-GOP to improve visual quality.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.Syntax
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Syntax. Produces a bitstream compliant with SMPTE RP-2027.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.TemporalAq
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TemporalAq. Temporal makes adjustments within each frame based on temporal variation of content complexity. The value to enter in this field depends on the value in the Adaptive quantization field: If you have set the Adaptive quantization field to Auto, MediaLive ignores any value in this field. MediaLive will determine if temporal AQ is appropriate and will apply the appropriate strength. If you have set the Adaptive quantization field to a strength, you can set this field to Enabled or Disabled. Enabled: MediaLive will apply temporal AQ using the specified strength. Disabled: MediaLive won't apply temporal AQ. If you have set the Adaptive quantization to Disabled, MediaLive ignores any value in this field and doesn't apply temporal AQ.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H264Settings.TimecodeInsertion
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TimecodeInsertion. Determines how timecodes should be inserted into the video elementary stream.- 'disabled': Do not include timecodes- 'picTimingSei': Pass through picture timing SEI messages from the source specified in Timecode Config

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265ColorSpaceSettings
member.summary: H265 Color Space Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265ColorSpaceSettings.ColorSpacePassthroughSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ColorSpacePassthroughSettings.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265ColorSpaceSettings.Hdr10Settings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Hdr10Settings.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265ColorSpaceSettings.Rec601Settings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Rec601Settings.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265ColorSpaceSettings.Rec709Settings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Rec709Settings.

member.summary: H265 Filter Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265FilterSettings.TemporalFilterSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TemporalFilterSettings.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings
member.summary: H265 Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.AdaptiveQuantization
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AdaptiveQuantization. Adaptive quantization. Allows intra-frame quantizers to vary to improve visual quality.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.AfdSignaling
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AfdSignaling. Indicates that AFD values will be written into the output stream. If afdSignaling is "auto", the system will try to preserve the input AFD value (in cases where multiple AFD values are valid). If set to "fixed", the AFD value will be the value configured in the fixedAfd parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.AlternativeTransferFunction
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AlternativeTransferFunction. Whether or not EML should insert an Alternative Transfer Function SEI message to support backwards compatibility with non-HDR decoders and displays.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.Bitrate
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Bitrate. Average bitrate in bits/second. Required when the rate control mode is VBR or CBR. Not used for QVBR. In an MS Smooth output group, each output must have a unique value when its bitrate is rounded down to the nearest multiple of 1000.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.BufSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BufSize. Size of buffer (HRD buffer model) in bits.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.ColorMetadata
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ColorMetadata. Includes colorspace metadata in the output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.ColorSpaceSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ColorSpaceSettings. Color Space settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.FilterSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FilterSettings. Optional filters that you can apply to an encode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.FixedAfd
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FixedAfd. Four bit AFD value to write on all frames of video in the output stream. Only valid when afdSignaling is set to 'Fixed'.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.FlickerAq
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FlickerAq. If set to enabled, adjust quantization within each frame to reduce flicker or 'pop' on I-frames.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.FramerateDenominator
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FramerateDenominator. Framerate denominator.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.FramerateNumerator
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FramerateNumerator. Framerate numerator - framerate is a fraction, e.g. 24000 / 1001 = 23.976 fps.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.GopClosedCadence
member.summary: Gets and sets the property GopClosedCadence. Frequency of closed GOPs. In streaming applications, it is recommended that this be set to 1 so a decoder joining mid-stream will receive an IDR frame as quickly as possible. Setting this value to 0 will break output segmenting.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.GopSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the property GopSize. GOP size (keyframe interval) in units of either frames or seconds per gopSizeUnits.If gopSizeUnits is frames, gopSize must be an integer and must be greater than or equal to 1.If gopSizeUnits is seconds, gopSize must be greater than 0, but need not be an integer.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.GopSizeUnits
member.summary: Gets and sets the property GopSizeUnits. Indicates if the gopSize is specified in frames or seconds. If seconds the system will convert the gopSize into a frame count at run time.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.Level
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Level. H.265 Level.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.LookAheadRateControl
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LookAheadRateControl. Amount of lookahead. A value of low can decrease latency and memory usage, while high can produce better quality for certain content.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.MaxBitrate
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MaxBitrate. For QVBR: See the tooltip for Quality level

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.MinIInterval
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MinIInterval. Only meaningful if sceneChangeDetect is set to enabled. Defaults to 5 if multiplex rate control is used. Enforces separation between repeated (cadence) I-frames and I-frames inserted by Scene Change Detection. If a scene change I-frame is within I-interval frames of a cadence I-frame, the GOP is shrunk and/or stretched to the scene change I-frame. GOP stretch requires enabling lookahead as well as setting I-interval. The normal cadence resumes for the next GOP. Note: Maximum GOP stretch = GOP size + Min-I-interval - 1

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.ParDenominator
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ParDenominator. Pixel Aspect Ratio denominator.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.H265Settings.ParNumerator
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ParNumerator. Pixel Aspect Ratio numerator.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property Profile. H.265 Profile.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property QvbrQualityLevel. Controls the target quality for the video encode. Applies only when the rate control mode is QVBR. Set values for the QVBR quality level field and Max bitrate field that suit your most important viewing devices. Recommended values are:- Primary screen: Quality level: 8 to 10. Max bitrate: 4M- PC or tablet: Quality level: 7. Max bitrate: 1.5M to 3M- Smartphone: Quality level: 6. Max bitrate: 1M to 1.5M

member.summary: Gets and sets the property TimecodeInsertion. Determines how timecodes should be inserted into the video elementary stream.- 'disabled': Do not include timecodes- 'picTimingSei': Pass through picture timing SEI messages from the source specified in Timecode Config

member.summary: Hdr10 Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Hdr10Settings.MaxCll
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MaxCll. Maximum Content Light LevelAn integer metadata value defining the maximum light level, in nits,of any single pixel within an encoded HDR video stream or file.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Hdr10Settings.MaxFall
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MaxFall. Maximum Frame Average Light LevelAn integer metadata value defining the maximum average light level, in nits,for any single frame within an encoded HDR video stream or file.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsAkamaiSettings
member.summary: Hls Akamai Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsAkamaiSettings.ConnectionRetryInterval
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ConnectionRetryInterval. Number of seconds to wait before retrying connection to the CDN if the connection is lost.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsAkamaiSettings.FilecacheDuration
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FilecacheDuration. Size in seconds of file cache for streaming outputs.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsAkamaiSettings.HttpTransferMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property HttpTransferMode. Specify whether or not to use chunked transfer encoding to Akamai. User should contact Akamai to enable this feature.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsAkamaiSettings.NumRetries
member.summary: Gets and sets the property NumRetries. Number of retry attempts that will be made before the Live Event is put into an error state.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsAkamaiSettings.RestartDelay
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RestartDelay. If a streaming output fails, number of seconds to wait until a restart is initiated. A value of 0 means never restart.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsAkamaiSettings.Salt
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Salt. Salt for authenticated Akamai.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsAkamaiSettings.Token
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Token. Token parameter for authenticated akamai. If not specified, _gda_ is used.
