member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings
member.summary: Hls Group Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.AdMarkers
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AdMarkers. Choose one or more ad marker types to pass SCTE35 signals through to this group of Apple HLS outputs.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.BaseUrlContent
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BaseUrlContent. A partial URI prefix that will be prepended to each output in the media .m3u8 file. Can be used if base manifest is delivered from a different URL than the main .m3u8 file.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.BaseUrlContent1
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BaseUrlContent1. Optional. One value per output group.This field is required only if you are completing Base URL content A, and the downstream system has notified you that the media files for pipeline 1 of all outputs are in a location different from the media files for pipeline 0.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.BaseUrlManifest
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BaseUrlManifest. A partial URI prefix that will be prepended to each output in the media .m3u8 file. Can be used if base manifest is delivered from a different URL than the main .m3u8 file.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.BaseUrlManifest1
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BaseUrlManifest1. Optional. One value per output group.Complete this field only if you are completing Base URL manifest A, and the downstream system has notified you that the child manifest files for pipeline 1 of all outputs are in a location different from the child manifest files for pipeline 0.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.CaptionLanguageMappings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CaptionLanguageMappings. Mapping of up to 4 caption channels to caption languages. Is only meaningful if captionLanguageSetting is set to "insert".

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.CaptionLanguageSetting
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CaptionLanguageSetting. Applies only to 608 Embedded output captions.insert: Include CLOSED-CAPTIONS lines in the manifest. Specify at least one language in the CC1 Language Code field. One CLOSED-CAPTION line is added for each Language Code you specify. Make sure to specify the languages in the order in which they appear in the original source (if the source is embedded format) or the order of the caption selectors (if the source is other than embedded). Otherwise, languages in the manifest will not match up properly with the output captions.none: Include CLOSED-CAPTIONS=NONE line in the manifest.omit: Omit any CLOSED-CAPTIONS line from the manifest.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.ClientCache
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ClientCache. When set to "disabled", sets the #EXT-X-ALLOW-CACHE:no tag in the manifest, which prevents clients from saving media segments for later replay.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.CodecSpecification
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CodecSpecification. Specification to use (RFC-6381 or the default RFC-4281) during m3u8 playlist generation.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.ConstantIv
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ConstantIv. For use with encryptionType. This is a 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character text string. If ivSource is set to "explicit" then this parameter is required and is used as the IV for encryption.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.Destination
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Destination. A directory or HTTP destination for the HLS segments, manifest files, and encryption keys (if enabled).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.DirectoryStructure
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DirectoryStructure. Place segments in subdirectories.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.DiscontinuityTags
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DiscontinuityTags. Specifies whether to insert EXT-X-DISCONTINUITY tags in the HLS child manifests for this output group.Typically, choose Insert because these tags are required in the manifest (according to the HLS specification) and serve an important purpose.Choose Never Insert only if the downstream system is doing real-time failover (without using the MediaLive automatic failover feature) and only if that downstream system has advised you to exclude the tags.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.EncryptionType
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EncryptionType. Encrypts the segments with the given encryption scheme. Exclude this parameter if no encryption is desired.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.HlsCdnSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property HlsCdnSettings. Parameters that control interactions with the CDN.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.HlsId3SegmentTagging
member.summary: Gets and sets the property HlsId3SegmentTagging. State of HLS ID3 Segment Tagging

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.IFrameOnlyPlaylists
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IFrameOnlyPlaylists. DISABLED: Do not create an I-frame-only manifest, but do create the master and media manifests (according to the Output Selection field).STANDARD: Create an I-frame-only manifest for each output that contains video, as well as the other manifests (according to the Output Selection field). The I-frame manifest contains a #EXT-X-I-FRAMES-ONLY tag to indicate it is I-frame only, and one or more #EXT-X-BYTERANGE entries identifying the I-frame position. For example, #EXT-X-BYTERANGE:160364@1461888"

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.IncompleteSegmentBehavior
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IncompleteSegmentBehavior. Specifies whether to include the final (incomplete) segment in the media output when the pipeline stops producing output because of a channel stop, a channel pause or a loss of input to the pipeline.Auto means that MediaLive decides whether to include the final segment, depending on the channel class and the types of output groups.Suppress means to never include the incomplete segment. We recommend you choose Auto and let MediaLive control the behavior.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.IndexNSegments
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IndexNSegments. Applies only if Mode field is LIVE.Specifies the maximum number of segments in the media manifest file. After this maximum, older segments are removed from the media manifest. This number must be smaller than the number in the Keep Segments field.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.InputLossAction
member.summary: Gets and sets the property InputLossAction. Parameter that control output group behavior on input loss.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.IvInManifest
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IvInManifest. For use with encryptionType. The IV (Initialization Vector) is a 128-bit number used in conjunction with the key for encrypting blocks. If set to "include", IV is listed in the manifest, otherwise the IV is not in the manifest.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.IvSource
member.summary: Gets and sets the property IvSource. For use with encryptionType. The IV (Initialization Vector) is a 128-bit number used in conjunction with the key for encrypting blocks. If this setting is "followsSegmentNumber", it will cause the IV to change every segment (to match the segment number). If this is set to "explicit", you must enter a constantIv value.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.KeepSegments
member.summary: Gets and sets the property KeepSegments. Applies only if Mode field is LIVE.Specifies the number of media segments to retain in the destination directory. This number should be bigger than indexNSegments (Num segments). We recommend (value = (2 x indexNsegments) + 1).If this "keep segments" number is too low, the following might happen: the player is still reading a media manifest file that lists this segment, but that segment has been removed from the destination directory (as directed by indexNSegments). This situation would result in a 404 HTTP error on the player.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.KeyFormat
member.summary: Gets and sets the property KeyFormat. The value specifies how the key is represented in the resource identified by the URI. If parameter is absent, an implicit value of "identity" is used. A reverse DNS string can also be given.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.KeyFormatVersions
member.summary: Gets and sets the property KeyFormatVersions. Either a single positive integer version value or a slash delimited list of version values (1/2/3).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.KeyProviderSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property KeyProviderSettings. The key provider settings.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.ManifestCompression
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ManifestCompression. When set to gzip, compresses HLS playlist.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.ManifestDurationFormat
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ManifestDurationFormat. Indicates whether the output manifest should use floating point or integer values for segment duration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.MinSegmentLength
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MinSegmentLength. When set, minimumSegmentLength is enforced by looking ahead and back within the specified range for a nearby avail and extending the segment size if needed.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.Mode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Mode. If "vod", all segments are indexed and kept permanently in the destination and manifest. If "live", only the number segments specified in keepSegments and indexNSegments are kept; newer segments replace older segments, which may prevent players from rewinding all the way to the beginning of the event.VOD mode uses HLS EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE of EVENT while the channel is running, converting it to a "VOD" type manifest on completion of the stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.OutputSelection
member.summary: Gets and sets the property OutputSelection. MANIFESTS_AND_SEGMENTS: Generates manifests (master manifest, if applicable, and media manifests) for this output group.VARIANT_MANIFESTS_AND_SEGMENTS: Generates media manifests for this output group, but not a master manifest.SEGMENTS_ONLY: Does not generate any manifests for this output group.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.ProgramDateTime
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ProgramDateTime. Includes or excludes EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag in .m3u8 manifest files. The value is calculated as follows: either the program date and time are initialized using the input timecode source, or the time is initialized using the input timecode source and the date is initialized using the timestampOffset.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.ProgramDateTimePeriod
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ProgramDateTimePeriod. Period of insertion of EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME entry, in seconds.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.RedundantManifest
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RedundantManifest. ENABLED: The master manifest (.m3u8 file) for each pipeline includes information about both pipelines: first its own media files, then the media files of the other pipeline. This feature allows playout device that support stale manifest detection to switch from one manifest to the other, when the current manifest seems to be stale. There are still two destinations and two master manifests, but both master manifests reference the media files from both pipelines.DISABLED: The master manifest (.m3u8 file) for each pipeline includes information about its own pipeline only.For an HLS output group with MediaPackage as the destination, the DISABLED behavior is always followed. MediaPackage regenerates the manifests it serves to players so a redundant manifest from MediaLive is irrelevant.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.SegmentationMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentationMode. useInputSegmentation has been deprecated. The configured segment size is always used.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.SegmentLength
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentLength. Length of MPEG-2 Transport Stream segments to create (in seconds). Note that segments will end on the next keyframe after this number of seconds, so actual segment length may be longer.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.SegmentsPerSubdirectory
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentsPerSubdirectory. Number of segments to write to a subdirectory before starting a new one. directoryStructure must be subdirectoryPerStream for this setting to have an effect.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.StreamInfResolution
member.summary: Gets and sets the property StreamInfResolution. Include or exclude RESOLUTION attribute for video in EXT-X-STREAM-INF tag of variant manifest.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.TimedMetadataId3Frame
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TimedMetadataId3Frame. Indicates ID3 frame that has the timecode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.TimedMetadataId3Period
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TimedMetadataId3Period. Timed Metadata interval in seconds.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.TimestampDeltaMilliseconds
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TimestampDeltaMilliseconds. Provides an extra millisecond delta offset to fine tune the timestamps.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsGroupSettings.TsFileMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TsFileMode. SEGMENTED_FILES: Emit the program as segments - multiple .ts media files.SINGLE_FILE: Applies only if Mode field is VOD. Emit the program as a single .ts media file. The media manifest includes #EXT-X-BYTERANGE tags to index segments for playback. A typical use for this value is when sending the output to AWS Elemental MediaConvert, which can accept only a single media file. Playback while the channel is running is not guaranteed due to HTTP server caching.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings
member.summary: Settings for the action to insert a user-defined ID3 tag in each HLS segment

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsId3SegmentTaggingScheduleActionSettings.Tag
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Tag. ID3 tag to insert into each segment. Supports special keyword identifiers to substitute in segment-related values.\nSupported keyword identifiers: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/medialive/latest/ug/variable-data-identifiers.html

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsInputSettings
member.summary: Hls Input Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsInputSettings.Bandwidth
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Bandwidth. When specified the HLS stream with the m3u8 BANDWIDTH that most closely matches this value will be chosen, otherwise the highest bandwidth stream in the m3u8 will be chosen. The bitrate is specified in bits per second, as in an HLS manifest.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsInputSettings.BufferSegments
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BufferSegments. When specified, reading of the HLS input will begin this many buffer segments from the end (most recently written segment). When not specified, the HLS input will begin with the first segment specified in the m3u8.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsInputSettings.Retries
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Retries. The number of consecutive times that attempts to read a manifest or segment must fail before the input is considered unavailable.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsInputSettings.RetryInterval
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RetryInterval. The number of seconds between retries when an attempt to read a manifest or segment fails.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.HlsInputSettings.Scte35Source
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Scte35Source. Identifies the source for the SCTE-35 messages that MediaLive will ingest. Messages can be ingested from the content segments (in the stream) or from tags in the playlist (the HLS manifest). MediaLive ignores SCTE-35 information in the source that is not selected.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Input.InputClass
member.summary: Gets and sets the property InputClass. STANDARD - MediaLive expects two sources to be connected to this input. If the channel is also STANDARD, both sources will be ingested. If the channel is SINGLE_PIPELINE, only the first source will be ingested; the second source will always be ignored, even if the first source fails.SINGLE_PIPELINE - You can connect only one source to this input. If the ChannelClass is also SINGLE_PIPELINE, this value is valid. If the ChannelClass is STANDARD, this value is not valid because the channel requires two sources in the input.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property FilterStrength. Adjusts the magnitude of filtering from 1 (minimal) to 5 (strongest).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.InputSettings.InputFilter
member.summary: Gets and sets the property InputFilter. Turns on the filter for this input. MPEG-2 inputs have the deblocking filter enabled by default.1) auto - filtering will be applied depending on input type/quality2) disabled - no filtering will be applied to the input3) forced - filtering will be applied regardless of input type

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.InputSettings.NetworkInputSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property NetworkInputSettings. Input settings.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.InputSettings.Smpte2038DataPreference
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Smpte2038DataPreference. Specifies whether to extract applicable ancillary data from a SMPTE-2038 source in this input. Applicable data types are captions, timecode, AFD, and SCTE-104 messages.- PREFER: Extract from SMPTE-2038 if present in this input, otherwise extract from another source (if any).- IGNORE: Never extract any ancillary data from SMPTE-2038.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.InputSettings.SourceEndBehavior
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SourceEndBehavior. Loop input if it is a file. This allows a file input to be streamed indefinitely.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.InputSettings.VideoSelector
member.summary: Gets and sets the property VideoSelector. Informs which video elementary stream to decode for input types that have multiple available.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.InputSource
member.summary: The settings for a PULL type input.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.InputSource.PasswordParam
member.summary: Gets and sets the property PasswordParam. The key used to extract the password from EC2 Parameter store.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.InputSource.Url
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Url. This represents the customer's source URL where stream ispulled from.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.InputSource.Username
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Username. The username for the input source.

member.summary: Settings for for a PULL type input.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.InputSpecification.Resolution

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings
member.summary: Settings for the "switch input" action: to switch from ingesting one input to ingesting another input.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings.InputAttachmentNameReference
member.summary: Gets and sets the property InputAttachmentNameReference. The name of the input attachment (not the name of the input!) to switch to. The name is specified in the channel configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings.InputClippingSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property InputClippingSettings. Settings to let you create a clip of the file input, in order to set up the input to ingest only a portion of the file.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings.UrlPath
member.summary: Gets and sets the property UrlPath. The value for the variable portion of the URL for the dynamic input, for this instance of the input. Each time you use the same dynamic input in an input switch action, you can provide a different value, in order to connect the input to a different content source.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.InputVpcRequest
member.summary: Settings for a private VPC Input.When this property is specified, the input destination addresses will be created in a VPC rather than with public Internet addresses.This property requires setting the roleArn property on Input creation.Not compatible with the inputSecurityGroups property.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.InputVpcRequest.SecurityGroupIds
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SecurityGroupIds. A list of up to 5 EC2 VPC security group IDs to attach to the Input VPC network interfaces.Requires subnetIds. If none are specified then the VPC default security group will be used.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.InputVpcRequest.SubnetIds
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SubnetIds. A list of 2 VPC subnet IDs from the same VPC.Subnet IDs must be mapped to two unique availability zones (AZ).

member.summary: Whitelist rule

member.summary: Gets and sets the property Cidr. The IPv4 CIDR that's whitelisted.

member.summary: An IPv4 CIDR to whitelist.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.InputWhitelistRuleCidr.Cidr
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Cidr. The IPv4 CIDR to whitelist.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings
member.summary: M2ts Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.AbsentInputAudioBehavior
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AbsentInputAudioBehavior. When set to drop, output audio streams will be removed from the program if the selected input audio stream is removed from the input. This allows the output audio configuration to dynamically change based on input configuration. If this is set to encodeSilence, all output audio streams will output encoded silence when not connected to an active input stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.Arib
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Arib. When set to enabled, uses ARIB-compliant field muxing and removes video descriptor.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.AribCaptionsPid
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AribCaptionsPid. Packet Identifier (PID) for ARIB Captions in the transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.AribCaptionsPidControl
P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.AudioBufferModel
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioBufferModel. When set to dvb, uses DVB buffer model for Dolby Digital audio. When set to atsc, the ATSC model is used.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.AudioFramesPerPes
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioFramesPerPes. The number of audio frames to insert for each PES packet.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.AudioPids
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioPids. Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary audio stream(s) in the transport stream. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal values. Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.AudioStreamType
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioStreamType. When set to atsc, uses stream type = 0x81 for AC3 and stream type = 0x87 for EAC3. When set to dvb, uses stream type = 0x06.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.Bitrate
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Bitrate. The output bitrate of the transport stream in bits per second. Setting to 0 lets the muxer automatically determine the appropriate bitrate.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.BufferModel
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BufferModel. Controls the timing accuracy for output network traffic. Leave as MULTIPLEX to ensure accurate network packet timing. Or set to NONE, which might result in lower latency but will result in more variability in output network packet timing. This variability might cause interruptions, jitter, or bursty behavior in your playback or receiving devices.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.CcDescriptor
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CcDescriptor. When set to enabled, generates captionServiceDescriptor in PMT.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.DvbNitSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DvbNitSettings. Inserts DVB Network Information Table (NIT) at the specified table repetition interval.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.DvbSdtSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DvbSdtSettings. Inserts DVB Service Description Table (SDT) at the specified table repetition interval.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.DvbSubPids
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DvbSubPids. Packet Identifier (PID) for input source DVB Subtitle data to this output. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal values. Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.DvbTdtSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DvbTdtSettings. Inserts DVB Time and Date Table (TDT) at the specified table repetition interval.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.DvbTeletextPid
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DvbTeletextPid. Packet Identifier (PID) for input source DVB Teletext data to this output. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.Ebif
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Ebif. If set to passthrough, passes any EBIF data from the input source to this output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.EbpAudioInterval
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EbpAudioInterval. When videoAndFixedIntervals is selected, audio EBP markers will be added to partitions 3 and 4. The interval between these additional markers will be fixed, and will be slightly shorter than the video EBP marker interval. Only available when EBP Cablelabs segmentation markers are selected. Partitions 1 and 2 will always follow the video interval.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.EbpLookaheadMs
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EbpLookaheadMs. When set, enforces that Encoder Boundary Points do not come within the specified time interval of each other by looking ahead at input video. If another EBP is going to come in within the specified time interval, the current EBP is not emitted, and the segment is "stretched" to the next marker. The lookahead value does not add latency to the system. The Live Event must be configured elsewhere to create sufficient latency to make the lookahead accurate.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.EbpPlacement
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EbpPlacement. Controls placement of EBP on Audio PIDs. If set to videoAndAudioPids, EBP markers will be placed on the video PID and all audio PIDs. If set to videoPid, EBP markers will be placed on only the video PID.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.EcmPid
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EcmPid. This field is unused and deprecated.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.EsRateInPes
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EsRateInPes. Include or exclude the ES Rate field in the PES header.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.EtvPlatformPid
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EtvPlatformPid. Packet Identifier (PID) for input source ETV Platform data to this output. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.EtvSignalPid
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EtvSignalPid. Packet Identifier (PID) for input source ETV Signal data to this output. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.FragmentTime
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FragmentTime. The length in seconds of each fragment. Only used with EBP markers.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.Klv
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Klv. If set to passthrough, passes any KLV data from the input source to this output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.KlvDataPids
member.summary: Gets and sets the property KlvDataPids. Packet Identifier (PID) for input source KLV data to this output. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal values. Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.NielsenId3Behavior
member.summary: Gets and sets the property NielsenId3Behavior. If set to passthrough, Nielsen inaudible tones for media tracking will be detected in the input audio and an equivalent ID3 tag will be inserted in the output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.NullPacketBitrate
member.summary: Gets and sets the property NullPacketBitrate. Value in bits per second of extra null packets to insert into the transport stream. This can be used if a downstream encryption system requires periodic null packets.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.PatInterval
member.summary: Gets and sets the property PatInterval. The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the output transport stream. Valid values are 0, 10..1000.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.PcrControl
member.summary: Gets and sets the property PcrControl. When set to pcrEveryPesPacket, a Program Clock Reference value is inserted for every Packetized Elementary Stream (PES) header. This parameter is effective only when the PCR PID is the same as the video or audio elementary stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.PcrPeriod
member.summary: Gets and sets the property PcrPeriod. Maximum time in milliseconds between Program Clock Reference (PCRs) inserted into the transport stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.PcrPid
member.summary: Gets and sets the property PcrPid. Packet Identifier (PID) of the Program Clock Reference (PCR) in the transport stream. When no value is given, the encoder will assign the same value as the Video PID. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.PmtInterval
member.summary: Gets and sets the property PmtInterval. The number of milliseconds between instances of this table in the output transport stream. Valid values are 0, 10..1000.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.PmtPid
member.summary: Gets and sets the property PmtPid. Packet Identifier (PID) for the Program Map Table (PMT) in the transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.ProgramNum
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ProgramNum. The value of the program number field in the Program Map Table.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.RateMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RateMode. When vbr, does not insert null packets into transport stream to fill specified bitrate. The bitrate setting acts as the maximum bitrate when vbr is set.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.Scte27Pids
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Scte27Pids. Packet Identifier (PID) for input source SCTE-27 data to this output. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal values. Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.Scte35Control
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Scte35Control. Optionally pass SCTE-35 signals from the input source to this output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.Scte35Pid
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Scte35Pid. Packet Identifier (PID) of the SCTE-35 stream in the transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.SegmentationMarkers
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentationMarkers. Inserts segmentation markers at each segmentationTime period. raiSegstart sets the Random Access Indicator bit in the adaptation field. raiAdapt sets the RAI bit and adds the current timecode in the private data bytes. psiSegstart inserts PAT and PMT tables at the start of segments. ebp adds Encoder Boundary Point information to the adaptation field as per OpenCable specification OC-SP-EBP-I01-130118. ebpLegacy adds Encoder Boundary Point information to the adaptation field using a legacy proprietary format.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.SegmentationStyle
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentationStyle. The segmentation style parameter controls how segmentation markers are inserted into the transport stream. With avails, it is possible that segments may be truncated, which can influence where future segmentation markers are inserted.When a segmentation style of "resetCadence" is selected and a segment is truncated due to an avail, we will reset the segmentation cadence. This means the subsequent segment will have a duration of $segmentationTime seconds.When a segmentation style of "maintainCadence" is selected and a segment is truncated due to an avail, we will not reset the segmentation cadence. This means the subsequent segment will likely be truncated as well. However, all segments after that will have a duration of $segmentationTime seconds. Note that EBP lookahead is a slight exception to this rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.SegmentationTime
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentationTime. The length in seconds of each segment. Required unless markers is set to _none_.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.TimedMetadataBehavior
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TimedMetadataBehavior. When set to passthrough, timed metadata will be passed through from input to output.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.TimedMetadataPid
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TimedMetadataPid. Packet Identifier (PID) of the timed metadata stream in the transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.TransportStreamId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TransportStreamId. The value of the transport stream ID field in the Program Map Table.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.M2tsSettings.VideoPid
member.summary: Gets and sets the property VideoPid. Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary video stream in the transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).

member.summary: Gets and sets the property ChannelId. ID of the channel in MediaPackage that is the destination for this output group. member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Mpeg2Settings.AdaptiveQuantization
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AdaptiveQuantization. Choose Off to disable adaptive quantization. Or choose another value to enable the quantizer and set its strength. The strengths are: Auto, Off, Low, Medium, High. When you enable this field, MediaLive allows intra-frame quantizers to vary, which might improve visual quality.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Mpeg2Settings.AfdSignaling
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AfdSignaling. Indicates the AFD values that MediaLive will write into the video encode. If you do not know what AFD signaling is, or if your downstream system has not given you guidance, choose AUTO.AUTO: MediaLive will try to preserve the input AFD value (in cases where multiple AFD values are valid).FIXED: MediaLive will use the value you specify in fixedAFD.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Mpeg2Settings.ColorMetadata
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ColorMetadata. Specifies whether to include the color space metadata. The metadata describes the color space that applies to the video (the colorSpace field). We recommend that you insert the metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Mpeg2Settings.ColorSpace
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ColorSpace. Choose the type of color space conversion to apply to the output. For detailed information on setting up both the input and the output to obtain the desired color space in the output, see the section on \"MediaLive Features - Video - color space\" in the MediaLive User Guide.PASSTHROUGH: Keep the color space of the input content - do not convert it.AUTO:Convert all content that is SD to rec 601, and convert all content that is HD to rec 709.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Mpeg2Settings.DisplayAspectRatio
member.summary: Gets and sets the property DisplayAspectRatio. Sets the pixel aspect ratio for the encode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Mpeg2Settings.FilterSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FilterSettings. Optionally specify a noise reduction filter, which can improve quality of compressed content. If you do not choose a filter, no filter will be applied.TEMPORAL: This filter is useful for both source content that is noisy (when it has excessive digital artifacts) and source content that is clean.When the content is noisy, the filter cleans up the source content before the encoding phase, with these two effects: First, it improves the output video quality because the content has been cleaned up. Secondly, it decreases the bandwidth because MediaLive does not waste bits on encoding noise.When the content is reasonably clean, the filter tends to decrease the bitrate.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Mpeg2Settings.FixedAfd
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FixedAfd. Complete this field only when afdSignaling is set to FIXED. Enter the AFD value (4 bits) to write on all frames of the video encode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Mpeg2Settings.FramerateDenominator
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FramerateDenominator. description": "The framerate denominator. For example, 1001. The framerate is the numerator divided by the denominator. For example, 24000 / 1001 = 23.976 FPS.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Mpeg2Settings.FramerateNumerator
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FramerateNumerator. The framerate numerator. For example, 24000. The framerate is the numerator divided by the denominator. For example, 24000 / 1001 = 23.976 FPS.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Mpeg2Settings.GopClosedCadence
member.summary: Gets and sets the property GopClosedCadence. MPEG2: default is open GOP.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Mpeg2Settings.GopNumBFrames
member.summary: Gets and sets the property GopNumBFrames. Relates to the GOP structure. The number of B-frames between reference frames. If you do not know what a B-frame is, use the default.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Mpeg2Settings.GopSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the property GopSize. Relates to the GOP structure. The GOP size (keyframe interval) in the units specified in gopSizeUnits. If you do not know what GOP is, use the default.If gopSizeUnits is frames, then the gopSize must be an integer and must be greater than or equal to 1.If gopSizeUnits is seconds, the gopSize must be greater than 0, but does not need to be an integer.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Mpeg2Settings.GopSizeUnits
member.summary: Gets and sets the property GopSizeUnits. Relates to the GOP structure. Specifies whether the gopSize is specified in frames or seconds. If you do not plan to change the default gopSize, leave the default. If you specify SECONDS, MediaLive will internally convert the gop size to a frame count.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Mpeg2Settings.ScanType
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ScanType. Set the scan type of the output to PROGRESSIVE or INTERLACED (top field first).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Mpeg2Settings.SubgopLength
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SubgopLength. Relates to the GOP structure. If you do not know what GOP is, use the default.FIXED: Set the number of B-frames in each sub-GOP to the value in gopNumBFrames.DYNAMIC: Let MediaLive optimize the number of B-frames in each sub-GOP, to improve visual quality.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Mpeg2Settings.TimecodeInsertion
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TimecodeInsertion. Determines how MediaLive inserts timecodes in the output video. For detailed information about setting up the input and the output for a timecode, see the section on \"MediaLive Features - Timecode configuration\" in the MediaLive User Guide.DISABLED: do not include timecodes.GOP_TIMECODE: Include timecode metadata in the GOP header.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings
member.summary: Ms Smooth Group Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.AcquisitionPointId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AcquisitionPointId. The ID to include in each message in the sparse track. Ignored if sparseTrackType is NONE.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.AudioOnlyTimecodeControl
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AudioOnlyTimecodeControl. If set to passthrough for an audio-only MS Smooth output, the fragment absolute time will be set to the current timecode. This option does not write timecodes to the audio elementary stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.CertificateMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CertificateMode. If set to verifyAuthenticity, verify the https certificate chain to a trusted Certificate Authority (CA). This will cause https outputs to self-signed certificates to fail.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.ConnectionRetryInterval
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ConnectionRetryInterval. Number of seconds to wait before retrying connection to the IIS server if the connection is lost. Content will be cached during this time and the cache will be be delivered to the IIS server once the connection is re-established.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.Destination
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Destination. Smooth Streaming publish point on an IIS server. Elemental Live acts as a "Push" encoder to IIS.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.EventId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EventId. MS Smooth event ID to be sent to the IIS server.Should only be specified if eventIdMode is set to useConfigured.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.EventIdMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EventIdMode. Specifies whether or not to send an event ID to the IIS server. If no event ID is sent and the same Live Event is used without changing the publishing point, clients might see cached video from the previous run.Options:- "useConfigured" - use the value provided in eventId- "useTimestamp" - generate and send an event ID based on the current timestamp- "noEventId" - do not send an event ID to the IIS server.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.EventStopBehavior
member.summary: Gets and sets the property EventStopBehavior. When set to sendEos, send EOS signal to IIS server when stopping the event

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.FilecacheDuration
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FilecacheDuration. Size in seconds of file cache for streaming outputs.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.FragmentLength
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FragmentLength. Length of mp4 fragments to generate (in seconds). Fragment length must be compatible with GOP size and framerate.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.InputLossAction
member.summary: Gets and sets the property InputLossAction. Parameter that control output group behavior on input loss.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.NumRetries
member.summary: Gets and sets the property NumRetries. Number of retry attempts.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.RestartDelay
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RestartDelay. Number of seconds before initiating a restart due to output failure, due to exhausting the numRetries on one segment, or exceeding filecacheDuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.SegmentationMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentationMode. useInputSegmentation has been deprecated. The configured segment size is always used.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.SendDelayMs
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SendDelayMs. Number of milliseconds to delay the output from the second pipeline.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.SparseTrackType
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SparseTrackType. Identifies the type of data to place in the sparse track:- SCTE35: Insert SCTE-35 messages from the source content. With each message, insert an IDR frame to start a new segment.- SCTE35_WITHOUT_SEGMENTATION: Insert SCTE-35 messages from the source content. With each message, insert an IDR frame but don't start a new segment.- NONE: Don't generate a sparse track for any outputs in this output group.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.StreamManifestBehavior
member.summary: Gets and sets the property StreamManifestBehavior. When set to send, send stream manifest so publishing point doesn't start until all streams start.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.TimestampOffset
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TimestampOffset. Timestamp offset for the event. Only used if timestampOffsetMode is set to useConfiguredOffset.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothGroupSettings.TimestampOffsetMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property TimestampOffsetMode. Type of timestamp date offset to use.- useEventStartDate: Use the date the event was started as the offset- useConfiguredOffset: Use an explicitly configured date as the offset

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothOutputSettings
member.summary: Ms Smooth Output Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothOutputSettings.H265PackagingType
member.summary: Gets and sets the property H265PackagingType. Only applicable when this output is referencing an H.265 video description.Specifies whether MP4 segments should be packaged as HEV1 or HVC1.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MsSmoothOutputSettings.NameModifier
member.summary: Gets and sets the property NameModifier. String concatenated to the end of the destination filename. Required for multiple outputs of the same type.

Keep in mind that each multiplex pipeline connects to both pipelines in a given source channel (the channel identified by the program). But only one of those channel pipelines is ever active at one time.

You do not need to specify the individual inputs to the Multiplex; MediaLive will handle the connection of the two MediaLive pipelines to the two Multiplex instances.The Multiplex must be in the same region as the Channel.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.MultiplexStatmuxVideoSettings.Priority
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Priority. The purpose of the priority is to use a combination of the
multiplex rate control algorithm and the QVBR capability of the
encoder to prioritize the video quality of some channels in a
multiplex over others. Channels that have a higher priority will
get higher video quality at the expense of the video quality of
other channels in the multiplex with lower priority.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.NetworkInputSettings.ServerValidation
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ServerValidation. Check HTTPS server certificates. When set to checkCryptographyOnly, cryptography in the certificate will be checked, but not the server's name. Certain subdomains (notably S3 buckets that use dots in the bucket name) do not strictly match the corresponding certificate's wildcard pattern and would otherwise cause the event to error. This setting is ignored for protocols that do not use https.

member.summary: Rtmp Caption Info Destination Settings

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.RtmpGroupSettings
member.summary: Rtmp Group Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.RtmpGroupSettings.AdMarkers
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AdMarkers. Choose the ad marker type for this output group. MediaLive will create a message based on the content of each SCTE-35 message, format it for that marker type, and insert it in the datastream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.RtmpGroupSettings.AuthenticationScheme
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AuthenticationScheme. Authentication scheme to use when connecting with CDN

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.RtmpGroupSettings.CacheFullBehavior
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CacheFullBehavior. Controls behavior when content cache fills up. If remote origin server stalls the RTMP connection and does not accept content fast enough the 'Media Cache' will fill up. When the cache reaches the duration specified by cacheLength the cache will stop accepting new content. If set to disconnectImmediately, the RTMP output will force a disconnect. Clear the media cache, and reconnect after restartDelay seconds. If set to waitForServer, the RTMP output will wait up to 5 minutes to allow the origin server to begin accepting data again.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.RtmpGroupSettings.CacheLength
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CacheLength. Cache length, in seconds, is used to calculate buffer size.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.RtmpGroupSettings.CaptionData
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CaptionData. Controls the types of data that passes to onCaptionInfo outputs. If set to 'all' then 608 and 708 carried DTVCC data will be passed. If set to 'field1AndField2608' then DTVCC data will be stripped out, but 608 data from both fields will be passed. If set to 'field1608' then only the data carried in 608 from field 1 video will be passed.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.RtmpGroupSettings.InputLossAction
member.summary: Gets and sets the property InputLossAction. Controls the behavior of this RTMP group if input becomes unavailable.- emitOutput: Emit a slate until input returns.- pauseOutput: Stop transmitting data until input returns. This does not close the underlying RTMP connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.RtmpGroupSettings.RestartDelay
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RestartDelay. If a streaming output fails, number of seconds to wait until a restart is initiated. A value of 0 means never restart.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.RtmpOutputSettings
member.summary: Rtmp Output Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.RtmpOutputSettings.CertificateMode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CertificateMode. If set to verifyAuthenticity, verify the tls certificate chain to a trusted Certificate Authority (CA). This will cause rtmps outputs with self-signed certificates to fail.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.RtmpOutputSettings.ConnectionRetryInterval
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ConnectionRetryInterval. Number of seconds to wait before retrying a connection to the Flash Media server if the connection is lost.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.RtmpOutputSettings.Destination
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Destination. The RTMP endpoint excluding the stream name (eg. rtmp://host/appname). For connection to Akamai, a username and password must be supplied. URI fields accept format identifiers.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.RtmpOutputSettings.NumRetries
member.summary: Gets and sets the property NumRetries. Number of retry attempts.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.ScheduleAction
member.summary: Contains information on a single schedule action.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.ScheduleAction.ActionName
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ActionName. The name of the action, must be unique within the schedule. This name provides the main reference to an action once it is added to the schedule. A name is unique if it is no longer in the schedule. The schedule is automatically cleaned up to remove actions with a start time of more than 1 hour ago (approximately) so at that point a name can be reused.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property Convert608To708. If upconvert, 608 data is both passed through via the "608 compatibility bytes" fields of the 708 wrapper as well as translated into 708. 708 data present in the source content will be discarded.

member.summary: Scte27 Source Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte27SourceSettings.OcrLanguage
member.summary: Gets and sets the property OcrLanguage. If you will configure a WebVTT caption description that references this caption selector, use this field toprovide the language to consider when translating the image-based source to text.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte27SourceSettings.Pid
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Pid. The pid field is used in conjunction with the caption selector languageCode field as follows: - Specify PID and Language: Extracts captions from that PID; the language is "informational". - Specify PID and omit Language: Extracts the specified PID. - Omit PID and specify Language: Extracts the specified language, whichever PID that happens to be. - Omit PID and omit Language: Valid only if source is DVB-Sub that is being passed through; all languages will be passed through.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte35DeliveryRestrictions
member.summary: Corresponds to SCTE-35 delivery_not_restricted_flag parameter. To declare delivery restrictions, include this element and its four "restriction" flags. To declare that there are no restrictions, omit this element.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor.SegmentationCancelIndicator
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentationCancelIndicator. Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_event_cancel_indicator.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor.SegmentationDuration
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentationDuration. Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_duration. Optional. The duration for the time_signal, in 90 KHz ticks. To convert seconds to ticks, multiple the seconds by 90,000. Enter time in 90 KHz clock ticks. If you do not enter a duration, the time_signal will continue until you insert a cancellation message.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor.SegmentationEventId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentationEventId. Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_event_id.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor.SegmentationTypeId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentationTypeId. Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_type_id. One of the segmentation_type_id values listed in the SCTE-35 specification. On the console, enter the ID in decimal (for example, "52"). In the CLI, API, or an SDK, enter the ID in hex (for example, "0x34") or decimal (for example, "52").

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor.SegmentationUpid
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentationUpid. Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_upid. Enter a string containing the hexadecimal representation of the characters that make up the SCTE-35 segmentation_upid value. Must contain an even number of hex characters. Do not include spaces between each hex pair. For example, the ASCII "ADS Information" becomes hex "41445320496e666f726d6174696f6e.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor.SegmentationUpidType
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentationUpidType. Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_upid_type. On the console, enter one of the types listed in the SCTE-35 specification, converted to a decimal. For example, "0x0C" hex from the specification is "12" in decimal. In the CLI, API, or an SDK, enter one of the types listed in the SCTE-35 specification, in either hex (for example, "0x0C" ) or in decimal (for example, "12").

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor.SegmentNum
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentNum. Corresponds to SCTE-35 segment_num. A value that is valid for the specified segmentation_type_id.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor.SegmentsExpected
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SegmentsExpected. Corresponds to SCTE-35 segments_expected. A value that is valid for the specified segmentation_type_id.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor.SubSegmentNum
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SubSegmentNum. Corresponds to SCTE-35 sub_segment_num. A value that is valid for the specified segmentation_type_id.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor.SubSegmentsExpected
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SubSegmentsExpected. Corresponds to SCTE-35 sub_segments_expected. A value that is valid for the specified segmentation_type_id.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte35SpliceInsert
member.summary: Scte35 Splice Insert

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte35SpliceInsert.AdAvailOffset
member.summary: Gets and sets the property AdAvailOffset. When specified, this offset (in milliseconds) is added to the input Ad Avail PTS time. This only applies to embedded SCTE 104/35 messages and does not apply to OOB messages.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte35SpliceInsert.NoRegionalBlackoutFlag
member.summary: Gets and sets the property NoRegionalBlackoutFlag. When set to ignore, Segment Descriptors with noRegionalBlackoutFlag set to 0 will no longer trigger blackouts or Ad Avail slates

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte35SpliceInsert.WebDeliveryAllowedFlag
member.summary: Gets and sets the property WebDeliveryAllowedFlag. When set to ignore, Segment Descriptors with webDeliveryAllowedFlag set to 0 will no longer trigger blackouts or Ad Avail slates

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings
member.summary: Settings for a SCTE-35 splice_insert message.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings.Duration
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Duration. Optional, the duration for the splice_insert, in 90 KHz ticks. To convert seconds to ticks, multiple the seconds by 90,000. If you enter a duration, there is an expectation that the downstream system can read the duration and cue in at that time. If you do not enter a duration, the splice_insert will continue indefinitely and there is an expectation that you will enter a return_to_network to end the splice_insert at the appropriate time.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.Scte35SpliceInsertScheduleActionSettings.SpliceEventId
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SpliceEventId. The splice_event_id for the SCTE-35 splice_insert, as defined in SCTE-35.

member.summary: Gets and sets the property Timecode. The timecode for the frame where you want to start the clip. Optional; if not specified, the clip starts at first frame in the file. Enter the timecode as HH:MM:SS:FF or HH:MM:SS;FF.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings
member.summary: Settings for the action to activate a static image.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings.Duration
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Duration. The duration in milliseconds for the image to remain on the video. If omitted or set to 0 the duration is unlimited and the image will remain until it is explicitly deactivated.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings.FadeIn
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FadeIn. The time in milliseconds for the image to fade in. The fade-in starts at the start time of the overlay. Default is 0 (no fade-in).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings.FadeOut
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FadeOut. Applies only if a duration is specified. The time in milliseconds for the image to fade out. The fade-out starts when the duration time is hit, so it effectively extends the duration. Default is 0 (no fade-out).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings.Height
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Height. The height of the image when inserted into the video, in pixels. The overlay will be scaled up or down to the specified height. Leave blank to use the native height of the overlay.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings.Image
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Image. The location and filename of the image file to overlay on the video. The file must be a 32-bit BMP, PNG, or TGA file, and must not be larger (in pixels) than the input video.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings.ImageX
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ImageX. Placement of the left edge of the overlay relative to the left edge of the video frame, in pixels. 0 (the default) is the left edge of the frame. If the placement causes the overlay to extend beyond the right edge of the underlying video, then the overlay is cropped on the right.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings.ImageY
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ImageY. Placement of the top edge of the overlay relative to the top edge of the video frame, in pixels. 0 (the default) is the top edge of the frame. If the placement causes the overlay to extend beyond the bottom edge of the underlying video, then the overlay is cropped on the bottom.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings.Layer
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Layer. The number of the layer, 0 to 7. There are 8 layers that can be overlaid on the video, each layer with a different image. The layers are in Z order, which means that overlays with higher values of layer are inserted on top of overlays with lower values of layer. Default is 0.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings.Opacity
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Opacity. Opacity of image where 0 is transparent and 100 is fully opaque. Default is 100.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.StaticImageActivateScheduleActionSettings.Width
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Width. The width of the image when inserted into the video, in pixels. The overlay will be scaled up or down to the specified width. Leave blank to use the native width of the overlay.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.StaticImageDeactivateScheduleActionSettings
member.summary: Settings for the action to deactivate the image in a specific layer.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.StaticImageDeactivateScheduleActionSettings.FadeOut
member.summary: Gets and sets the property FadeOut. The time in milliseconds for the image to fade out. Default is 0 (no fade-out).

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.StaticImageDeactivateScheduleActionSettings.Layer
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Layer. The image overlay layer to deactivate, 0 to 7. Default is 0.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.StopTimecode.LastFrameClippingBehavior
member.summary: Gets and sets the property LastFrameClippingBehavior. If you specify a StopTimecode in an input (in order to clip the file), you can specify if you want the clip to exclude (the default) or include the frame specified by the timecode.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.StopTimecode.Timecode
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Timecode. The timecode for the frame where you want to stop the clip. Optional; if not specified, the clip continues to the end of the file. Enter the timecode as HH:MM:SS:FF or HH:MM:SS;FF.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.TeletextDestinationSettings
member.summary: Teletext Destination Settings

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.TeletextSourceSettings
member.summary: Teletext Source Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.TeletextSourceSettings.OutputRectangle
member.summary: Gets and sets the property OutputRectangle. Optionally defines a region where TTML style captions will be displayed

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.TeletextSourceSettings.PageNumber
member.summary: Gets and sets the property PageNumber. Specifies the teletext page number within the data stream from which to extract captions. Range of 0x100 (256) to 0x8FF (2303). Unused for passthrough. Should be specified as a hexadecimal string with no "0x" prefix.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.TemporalFilterSettings
member.summary: Temporal Filter Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.TemporalFilterSettings.PostFilterSharpening
member.summary: Gets and sets the property PostFilterSharpening. If you enable this filter, the results are the following:- If the source content is noisy (it contains excessive digital artifacts), the filter cleans up the source.- If the source content is already clean, the filter tends to decrease the bitrate, especially when the rate control mode is QVBR.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.TemporalFilterSettings.Strength
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Strength. Choose a filter strength. We recommend a strength of 1 or 2. A higher strength might take out good information, resulting in an image that is overly soft.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.TimecodeConfig
member.summary: Timecode Config

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.TimecodeConfig.Source
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Source. Identifies the source for the timecode that will be associated with the events outputs.-Embedded (embedded): Initialize the output timecode with timecode from the the source. If no embedded timecode is detected in the source, the system falls back to using "Start at 0" (zerobased).-System Clock (systemclock): Use the UTC time.-Start at 0 (zerobased): The time of the first frame of the event will be 00:00:00:00.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.TimecodeConfig.SyncThreshold
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SyncThreshold. Threshold in frames beyond which output timecode is resynchronized to the input timecode. Discrepancies below this threshold are permitted to avoid unnecessary discontinuities in the output timecode. No timecode sync when this is not specified.

member.summary: Udp Group Settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.UdpGroupSettings.InputLossAction
member.summary: Gets and sets the property InputLossAction. Specifies behavior of last resort when input video is lost, and no more backup inputs are available. When dropTs is selected the entire transport stream will stop being emitted. When dropProgram is selected the program can be dropped from the transport stream (and replaced with null packets to meet the TS bitrate requirement). Or, when emitProgram is chosen the transport stream will continue to be produced normally with repeat frames, black frames, or slate frames substituted for the absent input video.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.UdpOutputSettings.BufferMsec
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BufferMsec. UDP output buffering in milliseconds. Larger values increase latency through the transcoder but simultaneously assist the transcoder in maintaining a constant, low-jitter UDP/RTP output while accommodating clock recovery, input switching, input disruptions, picture reordering, etc.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.VideoBlackFailoverSettings
member.summary: Placeholder documentation for VideoBlackFailoverSettings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.VideoBlackFailoverSettings.BlackDetectThreshold
member.summary: Gets and sets the property BlackDetectThreshold. A value used in calculating the threshold below which MediaLive considers a pixel to be 'black'. For the input to be considered black, every pixel in a frame must be below this threshold. The threshold is calculated as a percentage (expressed as a decimal) of white. Therefore .1 means 10% white (or 90% black). Note how the formula works for any color depth. For example, if you set this field to 0.1 in 10-bit color depth: (1023*0.1=102.3), which means a pixel value of 102 or less is 'black'. If you set this field to .1 in an 8-bit color depth: (255*0.1=25.5), which means a pixel value of 25 or less is 'black'. The range is 0.0 to 1.0, with any number of decimal places.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.VideoBlackFailoverSettings.VideoBlackThresholdMsec
member.summary: Gets and sets the property VideoBlackThresholdMsec. The amount of time (in milliseconds) that the active input must be black before automatic input failover occurs.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.VideoDescription
member.summary: Video settings for this stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.VideoDescription.CodecSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property CodecSettings. Video codec settings.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.VideoDescription.Height
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Height. Output video height, in pixels. Must be an even number. For most codecs, you can leave this field and width blank in order to use the height and width (resolution) from the source. Note, however, that leaving blank is not recommended. For the Frame Capture codec, height and width are required.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.VideoDescription.Name
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Name. The name of this VideoDescription. Outputs will use this name to uniquely identify this Description. Description names should be unique within this Live Event.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.VideoDescription.RespondToAfd
member.summary: Gets and sets the property RespondToAfd. Indicates how MediaLive will respond to the AFD values that might be in the input video. If you do not know what AFD signaling is, or if your downstream system has not given you guidance, choose PASSTHROUGH.RESPOND: MediaLive clips the input video using a formula that uses the AFD values (configured in afdSignaling ), the input display aspect ratio, and the output display aspect ratio. MediaLive also includes the AFD values in the output, unless the codec for this encode is FRAME_CAPTURE.PASSTHROUGH: MediaLive ignores the AFD values and does not clip the video. But MediaLive does include the values in the output.NONE: MediaLive does not clip the input video and does not include the AFD values in the output

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.VideoDescription.ScalingBehavior
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ScalingBehavior. STRETCH_TO_OUTPUT configures the output position to stretch the video to the specified output resolution (height and width). This option will override any position value. DEFAULT may insert black boxes (pillar boxes or letter boxes) around the video to provide the specified output resolution.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.VideoDescription.Sharpness
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Sharpness. Changes the strength of the anti-alias filter used for scaling. 0 is the softest setting, 100 is the sharpest. A setting of 50 is recommended for most content.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.VideoDescription.Width
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Width. Output video width, in pixels. Must be an even number. For most codecs, you can leave this field and height blank in order to use the height and width (resolution) from the source. Note, however, that leaving blank is not recommended. For the Frame Capture codec, height and width are required.

member.name: T:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.VideoSelector
member.summary: Specifies a particular video stream within an input source. An input may have only a single video selector.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.VideoSelector.ColorSpace
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ColorSpace. Specifies the color space of an input. This setting works in tandem with colorSpaceUsage and a video description's colorSpaceSettingsChoice to determine if any conversion will be performed.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.VideoSelector.ColorSpaceSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ColorSpaceSettings. Color space settings

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.VideoSelector.ColorSpaceUsage
member.summary: Gets and sets the property ColorSpaceUsage. Applies only if colorSpace is a value other than follow. This field controls how the value in the colorSpace field will be used. fallback means that when the input does include color space data, that data will be used, but when the input has no color space data, the value in colorSpace will be used. Choose fallback if your input is sometimes missing color space data, but when it does have color space data, that data is correct. force means to always use the value in colorSpace. Choose force if your input usually has no color space data or might have unreliable color space data.

member.name: P:Amazon.MediaLive.Model.VideoSelector.SelectorSettings
member.summary: Gets and sets the property SelectorSettings. The video selector settings.

member.name: M:Amazon.MediaLive.AmazonMediaLiveClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonMediaLiveClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.param: The region to connect.
